root: ^Trust is a fragile thing, my child. It takes time to build but only a moment to break. How do you decide who to trust?

s: ^I trust people who have proven they’re there for me.
^I find it hard to trust anyone, Gran.
^I trust easily, but sometimes I get hurt.

Trust_Proven: ^That’s wise. Trust should be earned, not given away freely. What do you value most in the people you trust?

s: ^Honesty. If someone is honest, I feel I can rely on them.
^Loyalty. I trust people who stand by me no matter what.

Value_Honesty: ^Honesty is a strong foundation for trust. Without it, relationships crumble. Always be truthful, my child.
Value_Loyalty: ^Loyalty is important, but make sure the people you trust deserve it. Blind loyalty can lead you astray.
Hard_To_Trust: ^I understand. It’s hard to open up when you’ve been hurt. But holding back can make you feel lonely. What’s made it so difficult for you to trust?

s: ^I’ve been let down too many times.

Let_Down: ^It’s painful to be let down, but don’t let past hurts stop you from building new connections. Not everyone will disappoint you.
Afraid_Of_Betrayal: ^Fear of betrayal can keep you isolated. Trusting again is hard, but it’s worth it when you find the right people.
Trust_Easily: ^It’s good to trust, but not everyone deserves it. Have you thought about how you can protect yourself while staying open?

s: ^I could take more time to get to know people before trusting them.
^I don’t think I’ll ever change. Trusting is just who I am.

Take_Time: ^That’s a good plan. Trusting slowly allows you to see who people really are before letting them in.
Wont_Change: ^It’s okay to be trusting, but remember to guard your heart. Not everyone has your best interests at heart.
